did.unittitle: Ivan Greenberg FBI Research Files on Labor and Radicalism

repository.corpname: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive

did.abstract: Ivan Greenberg is an historian and author.This collecion contains FBI files obtained under the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) by Greenberg on the Socialist Scholars Conference, the Socialist Workers Party, Dissent magazine, the Institute for Policy Studies, and Gus Hall.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Materials in this collection are in the public domain. Users need not secure permission from the Tamiment Library is not authorized to grant permission to publish or reproduce materials in this collection.

bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Ivan Greenberg is an historian and the author of The Dangers of Dissent: The FBI and Civil Liberties Since 1965 (Lexington Books, 2010).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This collecion contains FBI files obtained under the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) by Ivan Greenberg on the Socialist Scholars Conference, the Socialist Workers Party, Dissent magazine, the Institute for Policy Studies, and Gus Hall.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection has not been arranged by an archivist; materials are in the order in which they were received from the donor.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Donated by Ivan Greenberg in 2011. The accession number 2011.025 is associated with this gift.
